tasks.title: Set up AWS Infrastructure

- S3 bucket for blueprint storage

- Lambda function skeleton
- CloudWatch logging configuration

tasks.title: Implement Lambda Function for Image Processing
tasks.description: Implement Lambda function for image preprocessing and SageMaker endpoint invocation. Handle image resizing, normalization, coordinate transformation from pixel space to normalized 0-1000 range.
tasks.details:
✅ Lambda function implementation complete!

**Files Created:**
- lambda/handler.py - Main Lambda handler with image processing pipeline
- lambda/utils/image_processor.py - Image preprocessing utilities (resize, normalize)
- lambda/utils/coordinate_transformer.py - Coordinate transformation utilities
- lambda/utils/__init__.py - Package initialization
- lambda/requirements.txt - Python dependencies
- lambda/tests/test_handler.py - Comprehensive unit tests
- lambda/deploy.py - Deployment script
- aws/config/lambda-config.json - Lambda configuration

**Key Features:**
- Image preprocessing: Resize to 640x640 with aspect ratio preservation
- S3 integration: Downloads images from S3 bucket
- SageMaker integration: Invokes Serverless Inference endpoint
- Error handling: Comprehensive error handling with proper HTTP status codes
- Response formatting: Matches API specification format
- Unit tests: Complete test coverage for all components

**Configuration:**
- Runtime: Python 3.10
- Timeout: 300 seconds
- Memory: 1024 MB
- Environment variables: SAGEMAKER_ENDPOINT_NAME, S3_BUCKET, AWS_REGION

**Next Steps:**
- Deploy Lambda function to AWS
- Test with sample blueprint images
- Integrate with API Gateway (Task 8)

- .gitignore (add frontend build outputs)

**Key Requirements:**
- React with TypeScript
- Build tool (Vite recommended)
- Single-page application structure
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project builds and runs locally

subtasks.title: Initialize Git Repository
subtasks.description: Initialize a new Git repository in the project root to track changes.

subtasks.title: Create Project Structure
subtasks.description: Create the initial directory structure including the 'frontend' folder.

subtasks.title: Initialize React with TypeScript
subtasks.description: Use create-react-app with TypeScript template or Vite to initialize the React project in the 'frontend' directory.
subtasks.details: If using Vite, run 'npm create vite@latest frontend -- --template react-ts'.

subtasks.title: Set Up Build Configuration
subtasks.description: Configure the build tool (Vite or Webpack) for the project.
subtasks.details: For Vite, modify 'vite.config.ts'. For Webpack, create and configure 'webpack.config.js'.

subtasks.title: Install Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install necessary dependencies including React Router for routing and a state management library.
subtasks.details: Run 'npm install react-router-dom @reduxjs/toolkit react-redux' in the 'frontend' directory.

subtasks.title: Configure Routing
subtasks.description: Set up React Router for single-page application routing in 'App.tsx'.
subtasks.details: Implement <BrowserRouter> and define routes.

subtasks.title: Set Up State Management
subtasks.description: Configure Redux Toolkit for state management in the project.
subtasks.details: Create a store in 'src/app/store.ts' and integrate it with the app in 'index.tsx'.

subtasks.title: Update .gitignore Files
subtasks.description: Add node_modules and build outputs to '.gitignore' in the project root and the 'frontend' directory.
subtasks.details: Ensure 'frontend/.gitignore' includes 'node_modules/' and 'dist/'. Update root '.gitignore' to include frontend build outputs.

tasks.title: Implement File Upload Component
tasks.description: Implement drag & drop file upload component with file validation (PNG/JPG, max 50MB). Add file preview, process button, error handling.
tasks.details:
**Files to Create:**
- frontend/src/components/FileUpload.tsx
- frontend/src/components/FileUpload.module.css (or FileUpload.css)
- frontend/src/utils/fileValidation.ts
- frontend/src/types/file.ts

**Files to Modify:**
- frontend/src/App.tsx (integrate upload component)

**Key Requirements:**
- Drag & drop support
- File browser alternative
- PNG/JPG validation
- 50MB size limit
- File preview display
tasks.testStrategy: Test file upload with valid/invalid files, verify validation works

subtasks.title: Create FileUpload Component Skeleton
subtasks.description: Setup the initial structure for FileUpload.tsx and FileUpload.module.css.
subtasks.details: In FileUpload.tsx, define a basic functional component structure. In FileUpload.module.css, start with an empty file.

subtasks.title: Implement Drag & Drop
subtasks.description: Add drag and drop functionality to the FileUpload component.
subtasks.details: Use the 'react-dropzone' library for handling drag and drop. Ensure the drop zone is styled and indicates when a file is being dragged over it.

subtasks.title: Implement File Browser Upload
subtasks.description: Add a file input for users preferring to use a file browser instead of drag & drop.
subtasks.details: Include a file input button that opens the user's file browser. Style the button to match the component's theme.

subtasks.title: Develop File Validation Utility
subtasks.description: Create a utility function for validating file type and size.
subtasks.details: In fileValidation.ts, implement a function that checks a file's type against allowed types (PNG/JPG) and its size (max 50MB).

subtasks.title: Integrate File Validation
subtasks.description: Use the file validation utility in the FileUpload component to validate files on upload.
subtasks.details: After a file is selected or dropped, validate it using the utility from fileValidation.ts. Display an error message if the file is invalid.

subtasks.title: Implement File Preview
subtasks.description: Display a preview of the uploaded file in the FileUpload component.
subtasks.details: If the file passes validation, display a thumbnail preview for image files. Use a generic file icon for non-image files.

subtasks.title: Add Process Button
subtasks.description: Implement a 'Process' button that is enabled once a file is successfully uploaded and validated.
subtasks.details: The button should initially be disabled and only gets enabled when a valid file is uploaded. This button will later be linked to file processing logic.

subtasks.title: Integrate Upload Component in App
subtasks.description: Add the FileUpload component to the App.tsx file.
subtasks.details: Ensure the FileUpload component is imported and correctly displayed within the App component. Test the entire flow from file upload to validation.

tasks.title: Implement Blueprint Display Component
tasks.description: Implement blueprint image display with HTML5 Canvas overlay for bounding boxes. Handle image loading, canvas rendering, coordinate transformation from API (0-1000 range to pixels).
tasks.details:
**Files to Create:**
- frontend/src/components/BlueprintDisplay.tsx
- frontend/src/components/BlueprintDisplay.module.css
- frontend/src/utils/canvasRenderer.ts
- frontend/src/utils/coordinateTransformer.ts
- frontend/src/types/blueprint.ts

**Files to Modify:**
- frontend/src/App.tsx (integrate display component)

**Key Requirements:**
- Image display with aspect ratio preservation
- Canvas overlay synchronized with image
- Bounding box rendering with distinct colors
- Coordinate transformation (0-1000 → pixels)
- React front-end renders automatically-created room boundaries
tasks.testStrategy: Test with sample API response, verify bounding boxes render correctly on image

subtasks.title: Create Blueprint Display Component Files
subtasks.description: Create the necessary files for the Blueprint Display component.
subtasks.details: Create BlueprintDisplay.tsx, BlueprintDisplay.module.css in frontend/src/components/ and canvasRenderer.ts, coordinateTransformer.ts in frontend/src/utils/, and blueprint.ts in frontend/src/types/

subtasks.title: Implement Coordinate Transformation Utility
subtasks.description: Develop the utility for transforming coordinates from API range (0-1000) to pixels.
subtasks.details: Implement coordinate transformation logic in coordinateTransformer.ts, considering the aspect ratio and canvas size.

subtasks.title: Implement Canvas Renderer Utility
subtasks.description: Create the utility for rendering the canvas overlay, including bounding boxes.
subtasks.details: Develop canvas rendering functions in canvasRenderer.ts to draw bounding boxes over the blueprint image, using the coordinateTransformer for positioning.

subtasks.title: Setup Blueprint Display Component Structure
subtasks.description: Define the structure and initial state of the Blueprint Display component.
subtasks.details: In BlueprintDisplay.tsx, setup React component structure, state for image loading, and canvas reference.

subtasks.title: Implement Image Loading
subtasks.description: Implement logic for loading and displaying the blueprint image within the component.
subtasks.details: Use HTML5 File API for loading the image and the <canvas> element to display it, ensuring aspect ratio is preserved.

subtasks.title: Implement Bounding Box Rendering
subtasks.description: Render bounding boxes on the canvas overlay based on transformed coordinates.
subtasks.details: Utilize the canvasRenderer utility to draw bounding boxes on the canvas, overlaying the blueprint image.

subtasks.title: Integrate Blueprint Display in App
subtasks.description: Integrate the Blueprint Display component into the main application file.
subtasks.details: Modify App.tsx to include the BlueprintDisplay component, ensuring it renders correctly within the app's layout.

tasks.title: Implement Status & Loading Components
tasks.description: Implement loading indicators and status messages during processing. Add polling logic for async status updates, error state handling.
tasks.details:
**Files to Create:**
- frontend/src/components/LoadingIndicator.tsx
- frontend/src/components/StatusMessage.tsx
- frontend/src/hooks/usePolling.ts
- frontend/src/services/apiClient.ts
- frontend/src/types/api.ts

**Files to Modify:**
- frontend/src/App.tsx (add status management)

**Key Requirements:**
- Loading spinner/indicator
- Status messages (uploading, processing, complete)
- Polling hook (every 2-3 seconds)
- Error state handling
- API client for HTTP requests
tasks.testStrategy: Test polling logic, verify status updates display correctly

subtasks.title: Create LoadingIndicator Component
subtasks.description: Implement the LoadingIndicator.tsx component to display a loading spinner.
subtasks.details: Use a popular library like react-spinners for the spinner. Place the component in frontend/src/components.

subtasks.title: Create StatusMessage Component
subtasks.description: Implement the StatusMessage.tsx component to display status messages.
subtasks.details: This component should accept props to display different messages (uploading, processing, complete). Place the component in frontend/src/components.

subtasks.title: Develop usePolling Hook
subtasks.description: Create a custom React hook (usePolling.ts) for polling logic.
subtasks.details: The hook should perform an action (e.g., fetch data) every 2-3 seconds. Use useEffect and setInterval. Place the hook in frontend/src/hooks.

subtasks.title: Implement API Client
subtasks.description: Set up the apiClient.ts file in the services directory for making HTTP requests.
subtasks.details: Use Axios for HTTP requests. This client will be used by the polling hook and other components needing to communicate with the backend.

subtasks.title: Define API Types
subtasks.description: Create necessary TypeScript interfaces and types in api.ts for the API client.
subtasks.details: Define interfaces for the expected request and response data structures. Place this file in frontend/src/types.

subtasks.title: Integrate Loading and Status Components in App
subtasks.description: Modify App.tsx to include the LoadingIndicator and StatusMessage components.
subtasks.details: Use state management to control when these components are displayed based on the application's loading and processing status.

subtasks.title: Implement Error Handling
subtasks.description: Add error state handling in the application.
subtasks.details: Ensure that the StatusMessage component can display error messages. Also, incorporate error handling in the usePolling hook and API client.

tasks.title: Implement Export Functionality
tasks.description: Implement export buttons for annotated image (PNG with bounding boxes) and JSON coordinates. Create canvas export logic, file download functionality.
tasks.details:
**Files to Create:**
- frontend/src/components/ExportButtons.tsx
- frontend/src/utils/imageExporter.ts
- frontend/src/utils/jsonExporter.ts
- frontend/src/utils/canvasCompositor.ts

**Files to Modify:**
- frontend/src/components/BlueprintDisplay.tsx (add export handlers)

**Key Requirements:**
- Export annotated image (PNG with bounding boxes)
- Export JSON coordinates
- File download functionality
- Proper file naming (timestamp-based)
tasks.testStrategy: Test export buttons, verify downloaded files are correct format and contain expected data

subtasks.title: Create Export Button Component
subtasks.description: Develop the ExportButtons.tsx component in the frontend/src/components directory.
subtasks.details: This component should render buttons for exporting images and JSON data. Use React functional components and TypeScript.

subtasks.title: Implement Canvas Compositor Utility
subtasks.description: Create the canvasCompositor.ts utility in the frontend/src/utils directory.
subtasks.details: This utility should handle the creation of a canvas element to compose the annotated image. It will be used by the image export logic.

subtasks.title: Develop Image Export Logic
subtasks.description: Write the imageExporter.ts utility in the frontend/src/utils directory.
subtasks.details: This utility should use the canvasCompositor to generate a PNG image and trigger a download. Ensure the filename includes a timestamp.

subtasks.title: Develop JSON Export Logic
subtasks.description: Write the jsonExporter.ts utility in the frontend/src/utils directory.
subtasks.details: This utility should handle the extraction of JSON coordinates from the current state and trigger a file download with a timestamp in the filename.

subtasks.title: Integrate Export Functionality into BlueprintDisplay
subtasks.description: Modify the BlueprintDisplay.tsx component to include export handlers.
subtasks.details: Add onClick event listeners to the export buttons that trigger the appropriate export logic from imageExporter.ts and jsonExporter.ts.

subtasks.title: Test Export Functionality
subtasks.description: Conduct thorough testing of the export functionality to ensure reliability.
subtasks.details: Test cases should include exporting different sizes of images, various bounding box configurations, and ensuring JSON data matches the annotated state.

subtasks.title: Code Review and Refactoring
subtasks.description: Perform a code review and refactor as necessary to ensure code quality and maintainability.
subtasks.details: Focus on readability, performance optimizations, and adherence to project coding standards.

tasks.title: Error Handling & UI Polish
tasks.description: Implement error display component, add error recovery, polish UI styling and responsiveness. Add accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation).
tasks.details:
**Files to Create:**
- frontend/src/components/ErrorDisplay.tsx
- frontend/src/styles/global.css
- frontend/src/styles/variables.css (color palette, typography)
- frontend/src/utils/accessibility.ts

**Files to Modify:**
- All frontend components (add error handling, styling, accessibility)

**Key Requirements:**
- Error display component
- Error recovery (retry functionality)
- UI styling (color palette, typography, spacing)
- Responsive design
- Accessibility (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
tasks.testStrategy: Test error scenarios, verify accessibility with screen reader, test responsive layout

subtasks.title: Create Error Display Component
subtasks.description: Implement the ErrorDisplay.tsx component to show error messages.
subtasks.details: Use React for the component. It should accept error messages as props and display them appropriately.

subtasks.title: Implement Error Recovery
subtasks.description: Add retry functionality to the ErrorDisplay component.
subtasks.details: Include a 'Retry' button in the error display component that triggers a callback function passed as a prop.

subtasks.title: Develop Global Styles
subtasks.description: Create and apply global styles in global.css.
subtasks.details: Define basic styling rules, including body background, font family, and default margins.

subtasks.title: Define Color Palette and Typography
subtasks.description: Set up color and typography variables in variables.css.
subtasks.details: Define CSS variables for colors and font styles to ensure consistency across the UI.

subtasks.title: Enhance UI Responsiveness
subtasks.description: Ensure all frontend components are responsive.
subtasks.details: Use media queries in CSS to adjust layout and font sizes based on the screen size.

subtasks.title: Add Accessibility Features
subtasks.description: Implement ARIA labels and keyboard navigation in all frontend components.
subtasks.details: Use aria-labels for all interactive elements and ensure tab navigation works seamlessly across the application.

subtasks.title: Integrate Error Handling in Components
subtasks.description: Add error handling logic to all frontend components.
subtasks.details: Wrap components in error boundaries and use the ErrorDisplay component to show errors when they occur.

tasks.title: End-to-End Testing
tasks.description: Test complete workflow with multiple blueprint samples. Verify processing time <30 seconds, validate bounding box accuracy, test export functionality.
tasks.details:

**Key Requirements:**
- Test full workflow (upload → process → view → export)
- Verify processing time <30 seconds

tasks.testStrategy: Run end-to-end tests, verify all functionality works together, check performance metrics

subtasks.title: Prepare Test Environment
subtasks.description: Set up the testing environment including all necessary dependencies.
subtasks.details: Ensure the latest version of the application is installed along with any required testing frameworks or libraries.

subtasks.title: Create Test Blueprint Samples
subtasks.description: Generate or collect multiple blueprint samples to use for testing.
subtasks.details: Store the samples in tests/fixtures/sample_blueprints/ ensuring a variety of sizes and complexities.

subtasks.title: Develop End-to-End Test Script
subtasks.description: Write the test script in Python or TypeScript that covers the full workflow.
subtasks.details: The script should automate the upload, processing, viewing, and exporting of blueprint samples. Save the script as tests/e2e/test_workflow.py or tests/e2e/test_workflow.spec.ts.

subtasks.title: Implement Processing Time Verification
subtasks.description: Enhance the test script to verify that processing time is under 30 seconds.
subtasks.details: Include timers in the script to measure processing time from upload to completion of processing.

subtasks.title: Implement Bounding Box Accuracy Validation
subtasks.description: Modify the test script to validate the accuracy of bounding boxes.
subtasks.details: This may involve comparing the output against a set of expected values or using a tool to measure accuracy.

subtasks.title: Run End-to-End Tests
subtasks.description: Execute the test script with the prepared blueprint samples and record the results.
subtasks.details: Ensure tests cover all aspects of the workflow and use a variety of blueprint samples. Save the results in tests/reports/test_results.json.

subtasks.title: Update README with Testing Instructions
subtasks.description: Add instructions for running the end-to-end tests to the README.md file.
subtasks.details: Include any setup requirements, how to execute the tests, and how to interpret the test results.

subtasks.title: Gather API Information
subtasks.description: Collect all necessary information about the API, including endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication methods.

subtasks.title: Write API Documentation
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive documentation for the API in docs/API.md, detailing endpoints, usage examples, and error codes.
subtasks.details: Use Markdown format for documentation, include code snippets where applicable.

subtasks.title: Create Setup Guide
subtasks.description: Write a detailed setup and deployment guide in docs/SETUP.md, including prerequisites, installation steps, and configuration settings.
subtasks.details: Ensure the guide is clear and can be followed by new users without prior knowledge of the system.

subtasks.title: Design Architecture Diagram
subtasks.description: Create a detailed architecture diagram in docs/ARCHITECTURE.md, showing the system's components and how they interact.
subtasks.details: Use diagramming tools like Lucidchart or Draw.io and embed the final image in the Markdown document.

subtasks.title: Prepare Model Training Documentation
subtasks.description: Document the model training process, including data requirements, training steps, and evaluation metrics in docs/TRAINING.md.

subtasks.title: Develop Demo Script
subtasks.description: Write a script for the demo in demo/demo_script.md, outlining the steps to showcase the project's key features.
subtasks.details: Include any necessary commands, expected outputs, and commentary to explain the features being demonstrated.

subtasks.title: Create Demo Materials
subtasks.description: Prepare sample blueprints and other materials required for the demo, storing them in demo/sample_blueprints/.
subtasks.details: Ensure materials are clear, relevant, and enhance the demonstration.

subtasks.title: Update README.md
subtasks.description: Revise the README.md to provide a comprehensive project overview, including links to the new documents created.
subtasks.details: Highlight key features, usage examples, and direct users to the detailed documentation for more information.
